page.title: 02HARTPURY CHURCH,BARN,MILL
page.content: This area is of historical interest illustrating life since Domesday. The Church, dating from C11th, has Norman arches, and a C14th tower and chancel. The C12th century Tithe Barn is one of the largest in Gloucestshire and its roof was extensively renovated in 1982. To the south there was a farmhouse, Abbot's Place, (part of the medieval Gloucester Abbey Estate) which Hartpury Court replaced in C18th. By the Court the former Roman Catholic Chapel in the present barn is still detectable (used 1794-1837; 1930-1947) The owner of Hartpury Mill has recently restored the water wheel, paddles and mill race. Today these are favourite subjects for local artists - of which there are three of note in the village.
